January 27, 2022
Hawk1113
To look at this through two lenses: - This is the best version of Dane we've ever gotten. Coming in significantly lower point wise than his "aged like milk" Chaos War and Age of Ultron dials with a dial nearly as long as his Fantastic Forces Vet dial, this is a sturdy tanky Black Knight. He lacks the Steal Energy of other incarnations, but makes up for that with opening Invulnerable. Most valuable is that this is only our second Dane with an opening "11" attack, and the only Dane without a single stinky "9" anywhere on that track - all critical stuff for a Brawler. If you want to run The Black Knight on any of his named teams (oh yeah, this one has every relevant named keyword except for Knights of Wundagore) this is the de facto pick with only the slightest pause for the A/D SR for Defenders teams (and even then...you lose a lot of stats for that Defenders TA + Trait). - On the other hand, this dial doesn't even look that great compared to Shifting Focus Thor in the same set. 'Clix these days isn't kind to 0-range brawlers over 50 points who don't boast a Stop Click, Charge/Flurry, Stealth, or much more robust reducers. So he's mostly just nice for comic accurate teams to finally have a Dane that doesn't drag the whole team down.
January 27, 2022
Goop
Blades with some built in incap i guess is ok, feels a bit overcosted at 75pts. The defensive power option seems good until you realize he's a close combat piece and will likely always have to choose CR. He does have CCE and Flurry at the end so that is good. He's ok.
